CampaignManager.instructions: Do not use HTML <table>. Use a vertical stack of 'Row Cards' using Flexbox/Grid. This allows for better responsiveness and richer content inside each row.

CampaignRow.visual_style: bg-[#121212] border border-white/5 hover:border-[#d4a968]/30 hover:bg-[#161616] transition-all duration-200 group relative overflow-hidden

columns.name: Info
columns.content: Brand Logo (Avatar) + Campaign Name + Category Badge

columns.name: Applications
columns.content: Mini-stat cluster: Total (Gray), Pending (Orange - Highlighted), Approved (Green)

columns.name: Deliveries
columns.content: Split view: URL Icon (Status Dot) | Metrics Icon (Status Dot)

MetricsPill.style: flex items-center gap-2 px-3 py-1.5 rounded-md bg-white/5 border border-white/5 text-xs font-medium

implementation_steps: 1. Refactor 'AdminCampaignManager.jsx' to use the new 'Row Card' layout instead of the grid of large cards.
2. Create a 'CampaignToolbar' component for the filters (Search, Status, Brand).
3. Implement the 'Progress Bar' visual for slots (use a simple div with width %).
4. Add the 'Pending Review' indicator - this is the most critical user need. Make it pop (e.g., a red dot or orange badge count).
5. Ensure the 'Deliveries' column clearly separates 'Content URL' status from 'Metrics' status.
6. Maintain all existing functionality (Edit, Create, Transfer, Visibility Toggle) but move secondary actions to a Dropdown Menu to declutter.
universal_guidelines: Ensure text contrast meets WCAG AA (use lighter grays for secondary text, never dark gray on black).
Use 'Manrope' for numbers and headings to give a technical dashboard feel.
Avoid full-width gradients. Use subtle radial gradients for hover states.
